page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The area covered includes most of the village of Gislingham.The rest is farmland, with mainly small arable farms or pig units with some cattle. The land is low lying about 60m. above sea level with clay or loamy soil. The village is a lively community, its village hall being in constant use. Most of the male population work out of the area, except for those in farming. New houses are being built, at cheaper prices than in surrounding areas, attracting young families, although the breadwinner often has to commute at least 20 miles by car each day. The presence of a village primary school, although having an old and inconvenient building, is another
